ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: BroadScope Crawl and out of memory error
ygData.msgSnippet: Also, was the crawl job that OOME d started after another job had run w/o a restart of Heritrix between the running of the jobs?  Is this a case of [ 1123230
ygData.rawEmail:

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: BroadScope Crawl and out of memory error
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281
X-Yahoo-Profile: stackarchiveorg

Also, was the crawl job that OOME'd started after another job had run 
w/o a restart of Heritrix between the running of the jobs?  Is this a 
case of '[ 1123230 ] Out Of Memory after creating mutliple jobs' 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1123230&group_id=73833&atid=539099
Yours,
St.Ack
 

Gordon Mohr (@Internet Archive) wrote:

> Once an OutOfMemoryError is hit, a crawl attempts to pause, but will 
> often be
> unable to proceed in any meaningful way, depending on what operation was
> prevented by the OOM.
>
> Is the web UI responsive, and can you get a thread report?
>
> I notice a custom Processor, and HTML parser, in ToeThread #34. It would
> be interesting to see what URL that thread is working on, and for how 
> long.
> It, or other custom code that's growing a data structure as the crawl
> proceeds, could be the cause of the OOM. Our stock crawler components 
> might
> hit an OOM for any broad crawl eventually, but typically not so soon with
> such a large heap.
>
> - Gordon @ IA
>
> Saurabh Pathak wrote:
> >
> > Thanks for your reply Tom.
> >
> > I tried running a broadscope crawl using the current 1.3 snapshot of
> > the CVS head. I also used BdBFrontier with 50 threads and allocated
> > 1280M heap. This time again after downloading 250,000 or so documents
> > crawl came to a sudden halt as it ran out of memory and I received a
> > SEVERE alert as well.
> >
> > Also can somebody tell me what this line signifies in
> > progress-statistics.log file,
> >
> > 20050415033505 CRAWL WAITING TO PAUSE
> >
> > After the above line the busy thread count plummeted from 49 to 2.
> >

> > heritrix_out.log file (please excuse for unformatted data),

> > --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Tom Emerson <Tree@b...> wrote:
> >
> >>Broad=scope memory issues is a known problem. First off, see
> >>
> >>http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#oome_broadcrawl
> >>
> >>Secondly, I'd grab a 1.3 snapshot and try using that with the
> >>BdbFrontier --- it helps a lot.
> >>
> >>Finally, not that it is relevant for your specific case, I've been
> >>running a crawl for the last 7 days over 60 seeds using a set of
> >>custom SURT prefixes (including some rather open-ended ones, like
> >>"http://(cn,org, <http://%28cn,org,>").
> >>
> >>So far I've crawled 4,091,915 documents out of 10,610,687 discovered
> >>(so far) for 62 GB of data (I'm just saving HTML), running 75
> >>toe-threads with a 512MB heap. This is with a (now 7 day old) snapshot
> >>of CVS head. Heritrix is chugging along just fine at around 9.2 docs
> >>per second, 158 KB/sec, on an old 666 MHz i686.
> >>
> >>
> >>--
> >>Tom Emerson                                          Basis
